title: How to Make Banana Muffins

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375ºF/190ºC.
steps.description: Prepare a muffin pan (by greasing, only if needed).

steps.headline: Add the syrup, egg and mashed banana to the creamed mixture.
Mix just enough to combine.
steps.description: Add the flour and fold in.

steps.headline: Transfer the batter to the prepared muffin pan.
steps.description: Distribute the batter evenly in each hole of the pan.

steps.headline: Place in the preheated oven.
steps.description: Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Allow to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish cooling.

steps.headline: Serve warm or cooled.
steps.description: Consume within a day or two of baking.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: If you need grease the muffin pan do so, or add paper cases for the muffins.

steps.headline: Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt to a flour sifter.
steps.description: Sift into a mixing bowl and put to one side.

steps.headline: Place the mashed bananas into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar, egg and melted butter. Fold in the sifted flour mixture from the other bowl. Mix until smooth but don’t overmix.

steps.headline: Transfer the batter to the prepared muffin pan.
steps.description: Divide evenly across the pan.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 20 to 30 minutes if medium to large muffins, or 10 to 15 minutes if making mini muffins.

steps.headline: Remove from the heat.
steps.description: Allow to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish cooling.

steps.headline: Serve warm or cooled.
steps.description: Consume within a day or two.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.
steps.description: Prepare the muffin pan by greasing or lining it (using muffin cases).

steps.headline: Sift the flour, baking soda and salt into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the sugar. Stir to combine.

steps.headline: In another bowl, mix the mashed bananas, yogurt, eggs, butter and vanilla together.
Fold the flour mixture into the wet mixture.
steps.description: Mix quickly until combined. Fold in the hazelnuts.

steps.headline: Transfer the batter to the prepared muffin pan.
steps.description: Divide the batter evenly across the muffin pan holes.

steps.headline: Add a teaspoon of Nutella atop each muffin.
steps.description: Using a toothpick, swirl the Nutella across the top.

steps.headline: Place in the oven.
steps.description: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden.

steps.headline: Remove from the the oven.
steps.description: Allow to cool briefly in the pan, then remove and cool completely.

text: Banana muffins Preheat the oven to 375ºF/190ºC. Prepare a muffin pan (by greasing, only if needed). Cream the butter and sugar.  Add the syrup, egg and mashed banana to the creamed mixture.  Mix just enough to combine. Add the flour and fold in. Transfer the batter to the prepared muffin pan. Distribute the batter evenly in each hole of the pan. Place in the preheated oven. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the heat. Allow to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish cooling. Serve warm or cooled. Consume within a day or two of baking. Banana muffins with cinnamon Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. If you need grease the muffin pan do so, or add paper cases for the muffins. Add the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt to a flour sifter. Sift into a mixing bowl and put to one side. Place the mashed bananas into a mixing bowl. Add the sugar, egg and melted butter. Fold in the sifted flour mixture from the other bowl. Mix until smooth but don’t overmix. Transfer the batter to the prepared muffin pan. Divide evenly across the pan. Place in the oven. Bake for 20 to 30 minutes if medium to large muffins, or 10 to 15 minutes if making mini muffins. Remove from the heat. Allow to cool in the pan for a few minutes, then transfer to a wire cooling rack to finish cooling. Serve warm or cooled. Consume within a day or two. Banana Nutella muffins Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC. Prepare the muffin pan by greasing or lining it (using muffin cases). Sift the flour, baking soda and salt into a mixing bowl. Add the sugar. Stir to combine. In another bowl, mix the mashed bananas, yogurt, eggs, butter and vanilla together.  Fold the flour mixture into the wet mixture. Mix quickly until combined. Fold in the hazelnuts. Transfer the batter to the prepared muffin pan. Divide the batter evenly across the muffin pan holes. Add a teaspoon of Nutella atop each muffin. Using a toothpick, swirl the Nutella across the top. Place in the oven. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until golden. Remove from the the oven. Allow to cool briefly in the pan, then remove and cool completely. Serve warm or cooled.
